Package controller

Interface Features

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FeaturesImpl, TestFeatures.MockFeatures
    public interface Features
    Features interface. interfaces between the GUI View and controller makes the GUI methods work, like when a button is pressed it leads to a method here, and then usually calls a method in the controller after transforming the input to the correct format and doing what is needed to teh GUI, like refreshing the view to redraw or clearing the text box.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void callControllerOnInput​(java.lang.String typed)
      call what is needed based on input in text box.
      void changeFormat​(java.lang.String typed, java.lang.String button)
      Change the format of the string to simulate the text commands.
      void setView​(GUIView v)
      set the view attribute, and call add features in view.
      void switchLayer​(java.lang.String typed)
      switch which layer is the current layer in Project.

    • Method Detail

      • callControllerOnInput

        void callControllerOnInput​(java.lang.String typed)
        call what is needed based on input in text box. also reset the text box, and focus call handleUserInput in Controller to perform the actions based on typed and reset the view if a method was called that affects the way the view is drawn (set-filter, add-image-to-layer, new-project, load-project, add-layer)
        Parameters:
        typed - the input from the GUIView in the format of a text command

      • setView

        void setView​(GUIView v)
        set the view attribute, and call add features in view. to set up the button features
        Parameters:
        v - a GUIView

      • changeFormat

        void changeFormat​(java.lang.String typed,
                  java.lang.String button)
        Change the format of the string to simulate the text commands. so that it can be parsed by the Controller's usual methods (essentially convert what actions occurred in the GUI into what they would have looked like had the user typed them in with command prompts)
        Parameters:
        typed - the input from the GUI text box (file path, layer name, etc)
        button - the command prompt relevant to the button pressed in the GUI (ex: new-project)

      • switchLayer

        void switchLayer​(java.lang.String typed)
        switch which layer is the current layer in Project.
        Parameters:
        typed - which layer to switch the current layer to
